8.6.21  6:19 am   hey bill I've been a huge fan for a while now and your videos have helped me tremendously. I'm in a deep depression at the moment and I feel really hopeless. I was wondering if you could possibly give me some advice to help with my situation. I've suddenly started getting constant brain fog/issues with thinking around a year ago which is SUPER scary considering I'm only 18 and it feels like no one takes me seriously even though it quite literally ruined my life and made me spiral into the worst depression ever. I have always been bad at figuring out what to do so I'm wondering what you would recommend I do. I would kill to go back to when I didn't have this crippling brain fog. I'm sure I'll be fine + I know you are probably the wrong person to be asking about stuff like this but I mean I don't know who else to go to I don't have many friends. anyways keep up what you're doing me and many others really appreciate it. <3

8.5.21  6:03 pm   i really wonder the deeper reasons and thinking behind you not wanting to make an album. you often answer that with "songs are stronger one at a time" which makes a lot of sense, and i guess i can grasp the idea of what you mean by that. however the experience of listening to n many amount of songs and an album which is n songs long feels really really different to me?

     and also, i see no reason behind why the songs included in the album should lose the power of them being experienced one at a time.

      if you craft it with ingenuity, which you always do at all of your crafts in my opinion as far as the works you have currently made go, they could still be considered as n separate songs if wanted to by the experiencer. however, give a much differently beautiful, not stronger by definition (let's hope that both experiences have the same amount of strength which is as strong as possible) ocean of feelings, with a longer ride i guess?

      being in control of the order o f recommended listening, being able to do lots of interesting twists and turns by simply i dont know putting in some interlude tracks or whatever _you_ are going to invent at that road, and therefore a longer greater narrative outside the singular ones could turn into something deeper emotionally, with more investment.

      the songs that can still be experienced as single pieces which are strong enough for them to be considered "good", could also have a double triple however many as you much meaning at the whole picture, and n many songs could still be themselves in their own way? one doesn't even need to publish them one at a time, simply just planning the whole process at the writing is enough to make it so, i guess, and they could come as singles, when finished also as a whole with the extra album touches if necessary. and as far as i understood you have no problems in the writing departmant which comes like a natural language to you. this would only differentiate the process of writ ing, the amount of production that will be needed to put in would not rise, since there are still n many of songs which is lesser than the amount that you are already going to make? maybe i'm a sucker for continuity and your work and just want to listen to an album that has been made from you, i don't know. but you also don't seem like being a person who willingly refuses having more meaning, especially when the work going to be done is not exponentially increasing, which it doesn't seem like at this case. am i missing something?

     i would love to hear your reasoning behind not wanting to make albums in more depth, but for me it feels like those pictures made from other pictures square by square, it doesn't have to be like a jigsaw puzzle, pieces don't need to feel empty at any time, but still, you can have n beautiful pictures and a bigger greater +1, as a bonus, with nothing to lose.   

     thank you for all the inspiration and constant reminders of me having free will, it seems like i really do need that sometimes, and your work always finds a subtle way to ring that bell. sorry for the wall of text.

8.5.21  4:25 pm   i write music a lot, but I normally start with the instrumental and do melody/lyrics later, but i noticed while browsing through questions that you start with melody/lyrics first and then the harmony comes to you later.

     because you seem so efficient and you write songs that seem so perfect, it makes me feel I should do melody/lyrics first, and that just doesn't work well for me. it makes me wonder if there's an inherently wrong way to pursue my songwriting and if I should change my work process to match a more correct way?
